p: In vitro studies for DPPH, hydroxyl, and ABTS radical scavenging activity carried out by Kumar et al. to determine the antioxidant capacity of substances present in fenugreek seed extract ( Trigonella foenum-graecum), such as trigocoumarin (29) ( Figure 3), were performed. The antioxidant activity of the extract was expressed in IC 50 and showed its efficiency in reducing DPPH free radicals, being able to reduce them by 50% at a concentration of 395 μg/mL ( R 2 = 0.9712) [ 66].
